title: Who were the doctors that denied the possibility of hypnotizing healthy men, while Paris was fascinated by A.A. Liébeault's experiences?
first_phrase: In this text, the author disputes the claims of doctors who refuse to acknowledge his expertise in hypnosis. The author argues that he had been a prominent figure in the field before notable doctors such as Dr. Cullère, Dr. Beaunis, and Dr. Brémaud started to research hypnosis. The author further highlights his significant contributions to the field, citing his passion in Paris, press coverage, and his ability to mesmerize 30,000 people with two million spectators. The text ends with a mention of updates since it was written, including the appointment of M. Claretic as the Director of the Comédie-Française, and the recent passing of M. Simonin, a loss to the scientific and journalistic community.
